00003 =head1 NAME
00004 
00005     PGgraphmacros -- in courseScripts directory
00006 
00007 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00008 
00009 
00010 #       use Fun;
00011 #       use Label;
00012 #       use Circle;
00013 #       use WWPlot;
00014 
00015 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00016 
00017 This collection of macros provides easy access to the facilities provided by the graph
00018 module WWPlot and the modules for objects which can be drawn on a graph: functions (Fun.pm)
00019 labels (Label.pm) and images.  The only images implemented currently are open and closed circles
00020 (Circle) which can be used to mark graphs of functions defined on open and closed intervals.
00021 
00022 These macros provide an easy ability to graph simple functions.  More complicated projects
00023 may require direct access to the underlying modules.  If these complicated projects are common
00024 then it may be desirable to create additional macros.  (See numericalmacros.pl for one example.)
00025 
00026 
00027 =cut
00028 
00029 =head2 Other constructs
00030 
00031 See F<PGbasicmacros> for definitions of C<image> and C<caption>
00032 
00033 =cut

00039 #my $probNum       = $main::probNum;

00054 my %images_created = ();  # this keeps track of the base names of the images created during this session.
00055                      #  We tack on
00056                      # $imageNum  = ++$images_created{$imageName} to keep from overwriting files
00057                      # when we don't want to.

00061 
00062 =head2 init_graph
00063 
00064 =pod
00065 
00066         $graphObject = init_graph(xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax,'ticks'=>[4,4],'axes'=>[0,0])
00067         options are
00068             'grid' =>[8,8] or
00069             # there are 8 evenly spaced lines intersecting the horizontal axis
00070             'ticks'=>[8,8] and/or
00071             # there are 8 ticks on the horizontal axis, 8 on the vertical
00072             'axes' => [0,0]
00073             # axes pass through the point (0,0) in real coordinates
00074             'size' => [200,200]
00075             # dimensions of the graph in pixels.
00076             'pixels' =>[200,200]  # synonym for size
00077 
00078 Creates a graph object with the default size 200 by 200 pixels.
00079 If you want axes or grids you need to specify them in options. But the default values can be selected for you.
00080 
00081 
00082 =cut

00084     be_strict();
00085 }

00099 sub init_graph {
00100     my ($xmin,$ymin,$xmax,$ymax,%options) = @_;
00101     my @size;
00102     if ( defined($options{'size'}) ) {
00103         @size = @{$options{'size'}};
00104     }   elsif ( defined($options{'pixels'}) ) {
00105         @size = @{$options{'pixels'}};
00106     }   else {
00107         my $defaultSize = $main::envir{onTheFlyImageSize} || 200;
00108         @size=($defaultSize,  $defaultSize);
00109     }
00110     my $graphRef = new WWPlot(@size);
00111     # select a  name for this graph based on the user, the psvn and the problem
00112     my $setName = $main::setNumber;
00113     # replace dots, commmas and @ signs in set and user names to keep latex and html happy
00114     # this should be abstracted and placed in PGalias.pm or PGcore.pm or perhaps PG.pm
00115     #FIXME
00116     $setName =~ s/Q/QQ/g;
00117     $setName =~ s/\./-Q-/g;
00118     my $studentLogin = $main::studentLogin;
00119     $studentLogin =~ s/Q/QQ/g;
00120     $studentLogin =~ s/\./-Q-/g;
00121     $studentLogin =~ s/\,/-Q-/g;
00122     $studentLogin =~ s/\@/-Q-/g;
00123     my $imageName = "$studentLogin-$main::problemSeed-set${setName}prob${main::probNum}";
00124     # $imageNum counts the number of graphs with this name which have been created since PGgraphmacros.pl was initiated.
00125     my $imageNum  = ++$main::images_created{$imageName};
00126     # this provides a unique name for the graph -- it does not include an extension.
00127     $graphRef->imageName("${imageName}image${imageNum}");
00128 
00129     $graphRef->xmin($xmin) if defined($xmin);
00130     $graphRef->xmax($xmax) if defined($xmax);
00131     $graphRef->ymin($ymin) if defined($ymin);
00132     $graphRef->ymax($ymax) if defined($ymax);
00133     my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/8;
00134     my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/8;
00135     if (defined($options{grid})) {   #   draw grid
00136         my $xdiv = ( ${$options{'grid'}}[0]) ? ${$options{'grid'}}[0] : 8; # number of ticks (8 is default)
00137         my $ydiv = ( ${$options{'grid'}}[1] )  ? ${$options{'grid'}}[1] : 8;
00138         my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/$xdiv;
00139         my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/$ydiv;
00140         my $i; my @x_values=(); my @y_values=();
00141         foreach $i (1..($xdiv-1) ) {
00142             push( @x_values, $i*$x_delta+$graphRef->{xmin});
00143         }
00144         foreach $i (1..($ydiv-1) ) {
00145             push( @y_values, $i*$y_delta+$graphRef->{ymin});
00146         }
00147         $graphRef->v_grid('gray',@x_values);
00148         $graphRef->h_grid('gray',@y_values);
00149         $graphRef->lb(new Label($x_delta,0,sprintf("%1.1f",$x_delta),'black','center','middle'));
00150         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$y_delta,sprintf("%1.1f",$y_delta),'black','center','middle'));
00151 
00152         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmax,0,$xmax,'black','right'));
00153         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmin,0,$xmin,'black','left'));
00154         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymax,$ymax,'black','top'));
00155         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymin,$ymin,'black','bottom','right'));
00156 
00157     } elsif ($options{ticks}) {   #   draw ticks -- grid over rides ticks
00158         my $xdiv = ${$options{ticks}}[0]? ${$options{ticks}}[0] : 8; # number of ticks (8 is default)
00159             my $ydiv = ${$options{ticks}}[1]? ${$options{ticks}}[1] : 8;
00160         my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/$xdiv;
00161             my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/$ydiv;
00162             my $i; my @x_values=(); my @y_values=();
00163         foreach $i (1..($xdiv-1) ) {
00164             push( @x_values, $i*$x_delta+$graphRef->{xmin});
00165         }
00166         foreach $i (1..($ydiv-1) ) {
00167             push( @y_values, $i*$y_delta+$graphRef->{ymin});
00168         }
00169         $graphRef->h_ticks(0,'black',@x_values);
00170         $graphRef->v_ticks(0,'black',@y_values);
00171         $graphRef->lb(new Label($x_delta,0,$x_delta,'black','right'));
00172         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$y_delta,$y_delta,'black','top'));
00173 
00174         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmax,0,$xmax,'black','right'));
00175         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmin,0,$xmin,'black','left'));
00176         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymax,$ymax,'black','top'));
00177         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymin,$ymin,'black','bottom','right'));
00178     }
00179 
00180     if ($options{axes}) {   #   draw axis
00181         my $ra_axes = $options{axes};
00182         $graphRef->h_axis($ra_axes->[1],'black');
00183         $graphRef->v_axis($ra_axes->[0],'black');
00184     }
00185 
00186 
00187     $graphRef;
00188 }
00189 
00190 sub init_graph_no_labels {
00191     my ($xmin,$ymin,$xmax,$ymax,%options) = @_;
00192     my @size;
00193     if ( defined($options{'size'}) ) {
00194         @size = @{$options{'size'}};
00195     }   elsif ( defined($options{'pixels'}) ) {
00196         @size = @{$options{'pixels'}};
00197     }   else {
00198         my $defaultSize = $main::envir{onTheFlyImageSize} || 200;
00199         @size=($defaultSize,  $defaultSize);
00200     }
00201     my $graphRef = new WWPlot(@size);
00202     # select a  name for this graph based on the user, the psvn and the problem
00203     my $imageName = "$main::studentLogin-$main::psvn-set${main::setNumber}prob${main::probNum}";
00204     # $imageNum counts the number of graphs with this name which have been created since PGgraphmacros.pl was initiated.
00205     my $imageNum  = ++$main::images_created{$imageName};
00206     # this provides a unique name for the graph -- it does not include an extension.
00207     $graphRef->imageName("${imageName}image${imageNum}");
00208 
00209     $graphRef->xmin($xmin) if defined($xmin);
00210     $graphRef->xmax($xmax) if defined($xmax);
00211     $graphRef->ymin($ymin) if defined($ymin);
00212     $graphRef->ymax($ymax) if defined($ymax);
00213     my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/8;
00214     my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/8;
00215     if (defined($options{grid})) {   #   draw grid
00216         my $xdiv = ( ${$options{'grid'}}[0]) ? ${$options{'grid'}}[0] : 8; # number of ticks (8 is default)
00217         my $ydiv = ( ${$options{'grid'}}[1] )  ? ${$options{'grid'}}[1] : 8;
00218         my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/$xdiv;
00219         my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/$ydiv;
00220         my $i; my @x_values=(); my @y_values=();
00221         foreach $i (1..($xdiv-1) ) {
00222             push( @x_values, $i*$x_delta+$graphRef->{xmin});
00223         }
00224         foreach $i (1..($ydiv-1) ) {
00225             push( @y_values, $i*$y_delta+$graphRef->{ymin});
00226         }
00227         $graphRef->v_grid('gray',@x_values);
00228         $graphRef->h_grid('gray',@y_values);
00229         #$graphRef->lb(new Label($x_delta,0,sprintf("%1.1f",$x_delta),'black','center','top'));
00230         #$graphRef->lb(new Label($x_delta,0,"|",'black','center','middle'));
00231         #$graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$y_delta,sprintf("%1.1f ",$y_delta),'black','right','middle'));
00232         #$graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$y_delta,"-",'black','center','middle'));
00233 
00234 
00235         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmax,0,$xmax,'black','right'));
00236         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmin,0,$xmin,'black','left'));
00237         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymax,$ymax,'black','top','right'));
00238         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymin,$ymin,'black','bottom','right'));
00239 
00240     } elsif ($options{ticks}) {   #   draw ticks -- grid over rides ticks
00241         my $xdiv = ${$options{ticks}}[0]? ${$options{ticks}}[0] : 8; # number of ticks (8 is default)
00242             my $ydiv = ${$options{ticks}}[1]? ${$options{ticks}}[1] : 8;
00243         my $x_delta = ($graphRef->xmax -  $graphRef->xmin)/$xdiv;
00244             my $y_delta = ($graphRef->ymax -  $graphRef->ymin)/$ydiv;
00245             my $i; my @x_values=(); my @y_values=();
00246         foreach $i (1..($xdiv-1) ) {
00247             push( @x_values, $i*$x_delta+$graphRef->{xmin});
00248         }
00249         foreach $i (1..($ydiv-1) ) {
00250             push( @y_values, $i*$y_delta+$graphRef->{ymin});
00251         }
00252         $graphRef->v_ticks(0,'black',@x_values);
00253         $graphRef->h_ticks(0,'black',@y_values);
00254         $graphRef->lb(new Label($x_delta,0,$x_delta,'black','right'));
00255         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$y_delta,$y_delta,'black','top'));
00256 
00257         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmax,0,$xmax,'black','right'));
00258         $graphRef->lb(new Label($xmin,0,$xmin,'black','left'));
00259         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymax,$ymax,'black','top'));
00260         $graphRef->lb(new Label(0,$ymin,$ymin,'black','bottom','right'));
00261     }
00262 
00263     if ($options{axes}) {   #   draw axis
00264         my $ra_axes = $options{axes};
00265         $graphRef->h_axis($ra_axes->[1],'black');

00274 
00275 =head2  plot_functions
00276 
00277 =pod
00278 
00279     Usage:  ($f1, $f2, $f3) = plot_functions($graph, $f1, $f2, $f3);
00280     Synonym: add_functions($graph,$f1,$f2,$f3);
00281 
00282 Where $f1 is a string of the form
00283 
00284     $f1 = qq! x^2 - 3*x + 45 for x in [0, 45) using color:red and weight:2!
00285 
00286 The phrase translates as: formula    B<for> variable B<in>  interval B<using>   option-list.
00287 The option-list contains pairs of the form attribute:value.
00288 The default for color is "default_color" which is usually black.
00289 The default for the weight (pixel width) of the pen is 2 pixels.
00290 
00291 The string_to_sub subroutine is used to translate the formula into a subroutine.
00292 
00293 The functions in the list are installed in the graph object $graph and will appear when the graph object is next drawn.
00294 
00295 =cut
00296 
00297 sub add_functions {
00298     &plot_functions;
00299 }
00300 
00301 sub plot_functions {
00302     my $graph = shift;
00303     my @function_list = @_;
00304     my $error = "";
00305     $error .= "The first argument to plot_functions must be a graph object" unless ref($graph) =~/WWPlot/;
00306     my $fn;
00307     my @functions=();
00308     foreach $fn (@function_list) {
00309 
00310         # model:   "2.5-x^2 for x in <-1,0> using color:red and weight:2"
00311         if ($fn =~ /^(.+)for\s*(\w+)\s*in\s*([\(\[\<])\s*([\d\.\-]+)\s*,\s*([\d\.\-]+)\s*([\)\]\>])\s*using\s*(.*)$/ )  {
00312             my ($rule,$var, $left_br, $left_end, $right_end, $right_br, $options)=  ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7);
00313 
00314             my %options = split( /\s*and\s*|\s*:\s*|\s*,\s*|\s*=\s*|\s+/,$options);
00315             my ($color, $weight);
00316             if ( defined($options{'color'})  ){
00317                 $color = $options{'color'}; #set pen color
00318             }   else {
00319                 $color = 'default_color';
00320             }
00321             if ( defined($options{'weight'}) ) {
00322                 $weight = $options{'weight'}; # set pen weight (width in pixels)
00323             } else {
00324                 $weight =2;
00325             }
00326             # a workaround to call Parser code without loading MathObjects.
00327             my $localContext= Parser::Context->current(\%main::context)->copy;
00328             $localContext->variables->add($var=>'Real') unless $localContext->variables->get($var);
00329             my $formula = Value->Package("Formula()")->new($localContext,$rule)->perlFunction(undef,[$var]);
00330             my $subRef = sub {
00331               my $x = shift;
00332               my $y = Parser::Eval($formula,$x);  # traps errors, e.g. graph domain is larger than
00333                                   #  the function's domain.
00334               $y = $y->value if defined $y;
00335               return $y;
00336             };
00337             #my $subRef    = string_to_sub($rule,$var);
00338             my $funRef = new Fun($subRef,$graph);
00339             $funRef->color($color);
00340             $funRef->weight($weight);
00341             $funRef->domain($left_end , $right_end);
00342             push(@functions,$funRef);
00343             # place open (1,3) or closed (1,3) circle at the endpoints or do nothing <1,3>
00344             if ($left_br eq '[' ) {
00345                 $graph->stamps(closed_circle($left_end,&$subRef($left_end),$color) );
00346             } elsif ($left_br eq '(' ) {
00347                 $graph->stamps(open_circle($left_end, &$subRef($left_end), $color) );
00348             }
00349             if ($right_br eq ']' ) {
00350                 $graph->stamps(closed_circle($right_end,&$subRef($right_end),$color) );
00351             } elsif ($right_br eq ')' ) {
00352                 $graph->stamps(open_circle($right_end, &$subRef($right_end), $color) );
00353             }
00354 
00355         } else {
00356             $error .= "Error in parsing: $fn $main::BR";
00357         }
00358 
00359     }
00360     die ("Error in plot_functions: \n\t $error ") if $error;
00361     @functions;   # return function references unless there is an error.
00362 }

00366 
00367 =head2 insertGraph
00368 
00369     $filePath = insertGraph(graphObject);
00370           returns a path to the file containing the graph image.
00371 
00372 B<Note:> Because insertGraph involves writing to the disk, it is actually defined in dangerousMacros.pl.
00373 
00374 insertGraph(graphObject) writes a image file to the C<html/tmp/gif> directory of the current course.
00375 The file name is obtained from the graphObject.  Warnings are issued if errors occur while writing to
00376 the file.
00377 
00378 The permissions and ownership of the file are controlled by C<$main::tmp_file_permission>
00379 and C<$main::numericalGroupID>.
00380 
00381 B<Returns:>   A string containing the full path to the temporary file containing the  image.
00382 
00383 
00384 
00385 InsertGraph draws the object $graph, stores it in "${tempDirectory}gif/$imageName.gif (or .png)" where
00386 the $imageName is obtained from the graph object.  ConvertPath and surePathToTmpFile are used to insure
00387 that the correct directory separators are used for the platform and that the necessary directories
00388 are created if they are not already present.  The directory address to the file is the result.
00389 
00390 The most common use of C,insertGraph> is
00391 
00392     TEXT(image(insertGraph($graph)) );
00393 
00394 where C<image> takes care of creating the proper URL for accessing the graph and for creating the HTML code to display the image.
00395 
00396 Another common usage is:
00397 
00398     TEXT(htmlLink( alias(insertGraph($graph), "picture" ) ) );
00399 
00400 which inserts the URL pointing to the picture.
00401 alias converts the directory address to a URL when serving HTML pages and insures that
00402 an eps file is generated when creating TeX code for downloading. (Image, automatically applies alias to its input
00403 in order to obtain the URL.)
00404 
00405 See the documentation in F<dangerousMacros.pl> for the latest details.
00406 
00407 =cut
00408 
00409 =head2  'Circle' lables
00410 
00411     Usage: $circle_object = open_circle( $x_position, $y_position, $color );
00412             $circle_object2 = closed_circle( $x_position, $y_position, $color );
00413 
00414 Creates a small open (resp. filled in or closed) circle for use as a stamp in marking graphs.
00415 For example
00416 
00417     $graph -> stamps($circle_object2); # puts a filled dot at $x_position, $y_position
00418 
00419 =cut
00420 
00421 #########################################################
00422 sub open_circle {
00423     my ($cx,$cy,$color) = @_;
00424     new Circle ($cx, $cy, 4,$color,'nearwhite');
00425 }
00426 
00427 sub closed_circle {
00428     my ($cx,$cy, $color) = @_;
00429     $color = 'black' unless defined $color;
00430     new Circle ($cx, $cy, 4,$color, $color);
00431 }
00432 
00433 
00434 =head2 Auxiliary macros
00435 
00436 =head3  string_to_sub and my_math_constants
00437 
00438 
00439 These are internal macros which govern the interpretation of equations.
00440 
00441 
00442     Usage: $string = my_math_constants($string)
00443            $subroutine_reference = my_string_to_sub($string)
00444 
00445 C<my_math_constants>
00446 interprets pi, e  as mathematical constants 3.1415926... and 2.71828... respectively. (Case is important).
00447 The power operator ^ is replaced by ** to conform with perl constructs
00448 
00449 C<string_to_sub>
00450 converts a string defining a single perl arithmetic expression with independent variable $XVAR into a subroutine.
00451 The string is first filtered through C<my_math_macros>. The resulting subroutine
00452 takes a single real number as input and produces a single output value.
00453 
00454 =cut
00455 
00456 sub my_math_constants {
00457     my($in) = @_;
00458     $in =~s/\bpi\b/(4*atan2(1,1))/g;
00459     $in =~s/\be\b/(exp(1))/g;
00460     $in =~s/\^g;
00461     $in;
00462 }
00463 
00464 sub string_to_sub {
00465     my $str_in = shift;
00466     my $var    = shift;
00467     my $out = undef;
00468     if ( defined(&check_syntax)  ) {
00469         #prepare the correct answer and check it's syntax
00470         my $rh_correct_ans = new AnswerHash;
00471         $rh_correct_ans->input($str_in);
00472         $rh_correct_ans = check_syntax($rh_correct_ans);
00473         warn  $rh_correct_ans->{error_message} if $rh_correct_ans->{error_flag};
00474         $rh_correct_ans->clear_error();
00475         $rh_correct_ans = function_from_string2($rh_correct_ans, ra_vars => ['x'], store_in =>'rf_correct_ans');
00476         my $correct_eqn_sub = $rh_correct_ans->{rf_correct_ans};
00477         warn $rh_correct_ans->{error_message} if $rh_correct_ans->{error_flag};
00478         $out = sub{ scalar( &$correct_eqn_sub(@_) ) };  #ignore the error messages from the function.
00479 
00480     } else {
00481         my $in =$str_in;
00482 
00483         $in =~ s/\b$var\b/\$XVAR/g;
00484         $in = &my_math_constants($in);
00485         my ($subRef, $PG_eval_errors,$PG_full_error_report) = PG_restricted_eval( " sub { my \$XVAR = shift; my \$out = $in; \$out; } ");
00486         if ($PG_eval_errors) {
00487             die " ERROR while defining a function from the string:\n\n$main::BR $main::BR $str_in $main::BR $main::BR\n\n  $PG_eval_errors"
00488         } else {
00489             $out = $subRef;
00490         }
00491 
00492     }
00493     $out;
00494 }
